com.iota.iri.utils.log.interval

Class IntervalLogger

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.iota.iri.utils.log.interval.IntervalLogger
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Logger

    public class IntervalLogger
extends java.lang.Object
implements Logger
    This class represents a wrapper for the Logger used by IRI that implements a logic to rate limits the output on the console. Instead of printing all messages immediately and unnecessarily spamming the console, it only prints messages every few seconds and if the message has changed since the last output.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      IntervalLogger(java.lang.Class<?> clazz)
      Does the same as IntervalLogger(Class, int) but defaults to the DEFAULT_LOG_INTERVAL for the interval.
      IntervalLogger(java.lang.Class<?> clazz, int logInterval)
      Does the same as IntervalLogger(org.slf4j.Logger, int) but creates a new logback logger for the given class.
      IntervalLogger(org.slf4j.Logger logger)
      Does the same as IntervalLogger(org.slf4j.Logger, int) but defaults to the DEFAULT_LOG_INTERVAL for the interval.
      IntervalLogger(org.slf4j.Logger logger, int logInterval)
      Creates a Logger for the given class that prints messages only every logInterval milliseconds.

      • IntervalLogger

        public IntervalLogger(java.lang.Class<?> clazz)
        Does the same as IntervalLogger(Class, int) but defaults to the DEFAULT_LOG_INTERVAL for the interval.
        Parameters:
        clazz - class that is used to identify the origin of the log messages

      • IntervalLogger

        public IntervalLogger(org.slf4j.Logger logger)
        Does the same as IntervalLogger(org.slf4j.Logger, int) but defaults to the DEFAULT_LOG_INTERVAL for the interval.
        Parameters:
        logger - logback logger for issuing the messages

      • IntervalLogger

        public IntervalLogger(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                      int logInterval)
        Does the same as IntervalLogger(org.slf4j.Logger, int) but creates a new logback logger for the given class.
        Parameters:
        clazz - class that is used to identify the origin of the log messages
        logInterval - time in milliseconds between log messages

      • IntervalLogger

        public IntervalLogger(org.slf4j.Logger logger,
                      int logInterval)
        Creates a Logger for the given class that prints messages only every logInterval milliseconds. It simply stores the passed in parameters in its private properties to be able to access them later on.
        Parameters:
        logger - logback logger for issuing the messages
        logInterval - time in milliseconds between log messages

    • Method Detail

      • info

        public IntervalLogger info(java.lang.String message)
        This method allows us to set a new info message that shall get printed to the screen. It checks if the given message is new and then triggers the output.
        Specified by:

        Returns:
        the logger itself to allow the chaining of calls

      • error

        public IntervalLogger error(java.lang.String message)
        This method allows us to set a new error message that shall get printed to the screen. It checks if the given message is new and then triggers the output. Error messages will always get dumped immediately instead of scheduling their output. Since error messages are usually a sign of some misbehaviour of the node we want to be able to see them when they appear (to be able to track down bugs more easily).
        Specified by:
        error in interface Logger
        Parameters:
        message - debug message that shall get printed
        Returns:
        the logger itself to allow the chaining of calls

      • error

        public IntervalLogger error(java.lang.String message,
                            java.lang.Throwable cause)
        This method allows us to set a new error message that shall get printed to the screen. It checks if the given message is new and then triggers the output. Error messages will always get dumped immediately instead of scheduling their output. Since error messages are usually a sign of some misbehaviour of the node we want to be able to see them when they appear (to be able to track down bugs more easily).
        Specified by:
        error in interface Logger
        Parameters:
        message - debug message that shall get printed
        cause - exception object that caused the error to happen (will be printed with the complete stacktrace)

      • getEnabled

        public boolean getEnabled()
        This method is the getter for the enabled flag of the logger. If the logger is disabled it will simply omit showing log messages.
        Specified by:
        getEnabled in interface Logger
        Returns:
        true if the logger shall output messages and false otherwise (the logger is enabled by default)

      • setEnabled

        public IntervalLogger setEnabled(boolean enabled)
        This method is the setter for the enabled flag of the logger. If the logger is disabled it will simply omit showing log messages.
        Specified by:
        setEnabled in interface Logger
        Parameters:
        enabled - true if the logger shall output messages and false otherwise (the logger is enabled by default)
        Returns:
        the logger itself to allow the chaining of calls

      • triggerOutput

        public void triggerOutput()
        Does the same as triggerOutput(boolean) but defaults to letting the logger decide when to print the message.

      • triggerOutput

        public void triggerOutput(boolean printImmediately)
        Triggers the output of the last received message. It either prints the message immediately (if enough time has passed since the last output or requested by the caller) or schedules it for the next interval.
        Parameters:
        printImmediately - flag indicating if the messages should be scheduled or printed immediately
